text:
Stating the odds that an event will or will not occur is an alternative way of expressing
probabilities. Consider an event that has a probability of occurrence of 0.125, which is
one-eighth. The odds that the event will occur are
0.125_%
which we state
(1-0.125) 7
as, “the odds for the event occurring are one-to-seven." The odds against the event
occurring are the reciprocal of 1/7, which is seven-to-one.
